eccrypt package¶

Submodules¶

eccrypt.decrypt module¶

Decrypt a text file.

eccrypt.decrypt.decrypt(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Decrypt a binary file using a private key.

The decryption is provided by PyCryptodome.

Parameters:
  • *args – Input file[s].
  • **kwargs – Optional Arbitrary keyword arguments. They might represent a RSA private key or the output file[s].

Examples

The first argument is a list while the next argument can be both a string or a list, depending on the keyword.

>>> decrypt(['spam.bin'], rsa_private_key='rsa', output=['spam.text'])

eccrypt.encrypt module¶

Encrypt a text file.

https://www.pycryptodome.org/en/latest/src/examples.html#encrypt-data-with-rsa

Because of how the RSA algorithm works it is not possible to encrypt large files therefore the RSA key is used to encrypt the session key and the AES session key is used to encrypt the data.

eccrypt.encrypt.encrypt(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Encrypt a text file using a public key. The encryption is provided by PyCryptodome.

Parameters:
  • *args – Input file[s].
  • **kwargs – Optional Arbitrary keyword arguments. They might represent a RSA public key or the output file[s].

Examples

The first argument is a list while the next argument can be both a string or a list, depending on the keyword.

>>> encrypt(['egg.txt'], rsa_public_key='rsa.pub', output=['egg.bin'])

eccrypt.generate module¶

Generate RSA key pair.

eccrypt.generate.generate(filename='eccrypt_rsa', keytype='rsa')[source]¶

Generate a key pair based on the RSA algorithm.

Parameters:filename (str) – Name of the key pair.

Easy Crypt.

Easy encryption and decryption.
